sent_0: Background
sent_1: Hydrocoeles are common cystic scrotal abnormalities, described as a fluid-filled collection around the testicles.

sent_0: Background
sent_1: Hydrocoele can be treated with drainage of the fluid along with an injection of a chemical around the testicle to prevent recurrence, or with open surgery.

sent_0: Background
sent_1: The aim of this review is to compare these two types of treatment.

sent_0: Background
sent_1: We found four small studies were identified after an extensive literature search.

sent_1: Due to limited information about the design of the studies, and the small number of patients enrolled, the results should be interpreted with caution.

sent_0: Background
sent_1: Meta-analysis showed lower rates of recurrence in the surgery group, however there was insufficient evidence to draw a strong conclusion.

sent_0: Background
sent_1: Postoperative complications such as infection and fever, as well as cost and time to work resumption were less in the aspiration and sclerotherapy group; however the recurrence rate was higher.

sent_0: Background
sent_1: Cure at short-term follow-up was similar between the groups, however there is significant uncertainty in this result which may be as a result of the age of one of the studies and the different agent used compared to the other studies.
